function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of inter-sectoral collaboration and government agreements for covid-19 control policies","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community participation in disease prevention and management","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient focus on physical distancing and behavioral modification","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of stakeholder engagement in combating covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consultation of vulnerable populations in planning and response","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spontaneous behavioral reactions and rumors","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of fake news and misinformation","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant rise in domestic violence","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective communication leading to lack of updates and information for furloughed employees.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encouragement of others to move to gated communities may lead to societal segregation and inequitable access to resources and amenities during pandemics.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on the gated community environment for safety during pandemics may lead to complacency in implementing broader public health measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of education and awareness on ipc measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessment of workplace measures for preventing and controlling sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of inexperienced researchers for screening","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of bias in quality assessment","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low quality of evidence in cross-sectional studies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of random-effects meta-analysis method without considering common effect size","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential risk of low-quality studies influencing meta-analysis results","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited number of participants in some studies may result in skewed or unreliable findings.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low quality score of some studies, including cross-sectional studies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced human movement due to lockdowns","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inter-individual physical interaction","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Forbidding contact between people from different households","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specific description of ’possible sample’ leading to sampling bias","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adoption of easy random sampling without consideration of population characteristics","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on the central limit theorem for sample sizes greater than 30","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sample size in the research","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in credibility of personal opinions over scientific data","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cultural differences in perceiving and understanding recommendations for the built environment","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specific actions for health in the nua","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of cooperation between stakeholders","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of specific actions in the nua regarding health and the built environment","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Belief in spiritual causes of illness and rejection of proposed modifications to houses for disease prevention.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effectiveness of social media platforms’ efforts to remove misinformation","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low presence of accurate information in peer-reviewed journals and official institutions websites","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate sharing of inaccurate information on social media platforms","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disagreements and doubts in the classification process","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of the ’new norm’ under the threat of covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of free time as a reason for reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of a large student population","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lifestyle changes due to the pandemic leading to longer socio-psychological and behavioral implications","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public behavioral responses to covid-19 and previous outbreaks of infectious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of attention to official governmental media","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of trust in official governmental media","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gender and age differences in embracing protective behaviors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on official governmental media as the primary source of information","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trust in the source of information as a predictor of protective behaviors","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited explanation of the level of protective behaviors by knowledge alone","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High adoption level of protective behaviors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reluctance to adopt protective behaviors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
